articles.summary: Study analysed data from over 540,000 adults in Finland and the UK. To study worldwide estimates, the researchers then used global data from the Global Burden of Diseases (GBD) Study.

articles.summary: In India, infection-driven severe lung failure is common. Pneumonia, TB, air-pollution-related diseases make respiratory illness one of country’s leading causes of hospitalisation.

articles.summary: No copies of ex-Army chief's unapproved book published or sold: Penguin India

articles.title: Centre ‘attempting to silence’ Rahul Gandhi: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: Stating that Rahul Gandhi raised legitimate questions on national security based on excerpts from 'Four Stars of Destiny', the book authored by Naravane, he said the book, originally slated for release in 2024, remains unpublished because it is "being withheld" by the Government of India.

articles.title: ‘We need more exploration:’ Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on India’s push for energy independence
articles.summary: Anil Agarwal urges India to boost oil and gas exploration, noting vast resources and stressing energy independence amid heavy imports and global shifts, advocating regulatory reform for Viksit Bharat.

articles.title: India's US trade deal: Experts on how the import gap can be bridged
articles.summary: Experts said India’s trade gap with the US may be higher if services payments and spending by Indian students and firms are included. Energy imports such as LNG, LPG, and ethane are being seen as areas where India can increase US imports. However, supply limits and commercial pricing decisions will influence actual trade flows.

articles.title: Why India's Banking System Is Entering 2026 On Its Strongest Footing Yet
articles.summary: Moody's believes that the banking sectors' NIMs is set to improve amid cooling deposit costs.

articles.title: India–US interim trade deal LIVE updates: Export surge to push trade to $500B in 5 years - Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India–US interim trade deal LIVE updates: India and the United States announce an interim trade pact lowering tariffs, ending extra US duties on Indian goods, and boosting prospects for a full Bilateral Trade Agreement.

articles.title: Our strategic oil reserve can last up to 74 days: Hardeep Singh Puri
articles.summary: India's strategic petroleum reserves can currently cover 74 days of demand during global crises, according to Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri. While the International Energy Agency recommends 90 days, Puri expressed confidence in the current level, noting potential for future increases. This reserve is crucial for economic stability and energy security as India experiences rapid growth.

articles.title: Will be easy to purchase goods valued much more than $500 bn from US: Goyal
articles.summary: India is set to purchase USD 500 billion in goods from the US over the next five years. This figure is considered conservative, with demand expected to grow significantly. Sectors like aviation, energy, and technology will drive these purchases. India's competitive tariffs offer an advantage over other nations. Safeguards are in place to protect domestic industries and farmers.

articles.title: How US-India trade deal will affect imports, exports and industries, explains Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal outlined the India–US interim trade framework, promising zero duties on key imports, protection for sensitive sectors, and boosted exports, aiming for $500 billion bilateral trade.

articles.title: India-US deal will likely double Tamil Nadu garment exports to Rs 30,000 crore
articles.summary: Tiruppur garment exporters anticipate a significant boost from the India-US trade deal. Exports to the United States are projected to double to Rs 30,000 crore within three years. This growth is expected to create approximately 5 lakh new jobs in the textile town. The agreement is poised to bring more orders to Tamil Nadu, potentially diverting them from other countries.

articles.title: US India Trade Deal: 'Buying  oil from the US is in India's own strategic interests', says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: US India Trade Agreement: India is diversifying its energy sources by purchasing crude oil, LNG, and LPG from the US. Union Minister Piyush Goyal stated this move is in India's strategic interest. Commercial buyers and companies make these purchasing decisions. Trade deals focus on ensuring smooth trade pathways and preferential access. This ensures India has an advantage over competitors.

articles.title: 60-70% of India’s US farm imports may face low or no tariffs: Goldman Sachs
articles.summary: India and the United States have just sealed a pivotal trade pact that will cut down or completely remove tariffs on numerous US farm products being imported into India. Moreover, this deal also slashes tariffs on industrial items from the US.

articles.title: Quantum computing India's ticket to leading role in global tech space: Chandrababu Naidu
articles.summary: The Quantum Valley initiative launched in Andhra Pradesh is set to usher in the next wave of the information technology (IT) revolution in the country, Naidu said in an interview with PTI Videos, emphasising that it would position India as a hardware-and-manufacturing powerhouse, in addition to being a software-and-services hub.

articles.title: Very excited to invite India to join Pax Silica, says top US official
articles.summary: The United States has invited India to join the Pax Silica initiative focused on supply chain security. This move signals strong positive momentum in US-India relations. Under Secretary of State Jacob Helberg will soon sign an agreement with the Indian government. India's vast young, technically trained talent pool is seen as a key asset.

articles.title: India–US partnership set to reach new heights, says Piyush Goyal after meeting Ambassador Sergio Gor
articles.summary: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Tuesday expressed confidence that the India-US partnership will scale new heights in the coming period, particularly in the backdrop of the recently announced interim India-US trade deal.

articles.title: FM Sitharaman forgot last year's promises: Chidambaram
articles.summary: P. Chidambaram criticized the Union Budget 2026-27 in the Rajya Sabha, labeling it 'forgettable' for cutting capital expenditure. He highlighted stagnant capital investment, a collapse in net FDI, and withdrawing foreign portfolio investors, questioning the government's reform momentum. Chidambaram noted a decline in nominal growth and a lack of private investment despite companies holding significant cash.

articles.title: India's petroleum reserves can last 74 days in case of global turbulence: Oil Minister Puri
articles.summary: India's petroleum reserves can last 74 days in case of global turbulence: Oil Minister Puri

articles.title: How global companies are quietly turning India into their second home
articles.summary: Global capability centres are reshaping India’s office market, jobs and capital flows, turning the country into a long-term hub for high-value global work and growth.

articles.title: ED forms SIT to probe Anil Ambani, summons wife
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate has formed a special investigation team to probe alleged money laundering of Rs 40,000 crore against Anil Ambani and Reliance Group companies, following a Supreme Court directive. The probe includes investigating a Rs 70 crore Manhattan apartment purchase, with Tina Ambani potentially being summoned again.

articles.title: India-US interim trade deal to boost electronics, tech products and IP co-development, says Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Ashwini Vaishnaw announced India and US will boost technology trade, especially GPUs and data centers, with investments expected to exceed 200 billion dollars under the India AI mission.

articles.title: SWITCH Mobility rolls out 272 low-floor buses in Delhi
articles.summary: SWITCH Mobility rolled out 272 EiV12 electric buses from Ramlila Maidan, part of 950 buses for Delhi under CESL tender. Rekha Gupta flagged off the buses, supported by Ohm Global Mobility.

articles.title: Delhi: Mayur Vihar Pocket 1 Metro Station renamed Shri Ram Mandir Mayur Vihar
articles.summary: A government officer said that the decision was taken by the State Names Authority of Delhi, headed by Chief Minister Rekha Gupta.

articles.title: Cyber insurance and rising digital threats: How businesses can manage risk
articles.summary: Indian firms are turning to cyber insurance for risks like data breaches. Experts urge proactive security and frequent policy reviews.

articles.title: 'Abolish LTCG Tax on Equities': AAP MP Raghav Chadha
articles.summary: AAP MP Raghav Chadha highlighted international examples where long-term equity gains are largely tax-free.

articles.title: Using AI to tackle mule accounts to be in focus during two days conference by CBI, Centre
articles.summary: The use of artificial intelligence in tackling mule accounts, which form a key element in facilitating laundering of illicit funds stolen through cyber crimes, will be one of the focus areas of the two-day conference organised by the CBI and the Union Home Ministry's Indian Cyber Crime Coordination Centre (I4C) beginning Tuesday, officials said.

articles.title: India can no longer rely on IT service exports; need to move focus to deeptech, hardware: Nithin Kamath
articles.summary: The Zerodha founder said the shift is essential to build long-term economic resilience and reduce dependence on global outsourcing cycles. He said that there is adequate talent in India, but it is hobbled by an "ecosystem gap."

articles.title: Technology should not enslave you, AI should not be substitute for learning: PM to students
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged students to master technology, not be enslaved by it. He advised using Artificial Intelligence for guidance and value addition, not as a learning substitute. Modi also highlighted leadership qualities like fearlessness and initiative. He encouraged students to balance studies with passions and explore startups.

articles.title: Beyond velocity: How Flipkart is building for durability
articles.summary: From AI-powered inventory systems to modular dark stores, India's homegrown e-commerce platform is trading rapid expansion for the kind of operational maturity that creates sustainable competitive advantages.

articles.title: How India’s tech majors are fixing AI code review bottlenecks
articles.summary: From Swiggy's 100,000 reviewed pull requests to Freshworks' AI playground for non-technical staff, executives at the invite-only meetup, The Economic Times X CodeRabbit, revealed how they're shipping faster without breaking things.

articles.title: Zetwerk sees second high-profile exit ahead of IPO
articles.summary: IPO-bound manufacturing unicorn Zetwerk has seen another senior exit before its planned initial public offering. Electronics business head Josh Foulger has resigned within two years of joining. This follows last month’s resignation of chief marketing officer Amrit Raj, marking the second high-profile exit from the company, sources told PTI.

articles.title: Use tech to hone skills, improve potential: PM Narendra Modi to students
articles.summary: The prime minister urged students not to be afraid of emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, but use them to hone their skills and improve potential. The prime minister also urged students to practice previous papers and have a good sleep to perform better in examinations.

articles.title: UIDAI completes over 1 crore mandatory biometric updates for school children across 83,000 schools
articles.summary: A child under the age of five can enrol for Aadhaar by providing the photograph, name, date of birth, gender, address and birth certificate but the fingerprints and iris biometrics of a child are not captured for Aadhaar enrolment below the age of five as these indicators are not mature by then.

articles.title: Cybersecurity breaches emerge as top risk for India Inc: FICCI-EY Survey
articles.summary: The 'FICCI-EY Risk Survey 2026' identified changing customer demands (49%) and geopolitical events (48%) as the next two most critical risks facing businesses.

articles.title: Operation Cyber Hawk 3.0: Over 500 apprehended in Delhi Police's cyber crackdown
articles.summary: Operation Cyber Hawk 3.0 targets organised cyber fraud networks operating across multiple digital platforms. The action involves advanced technical analysis, real-time intelligence inputs, financial trail tracking and coordinated field operations to identify and dismantle cybercrime syndicates.

articles.title: Exports may hit $1 Tn in FY27 on new trade deals, tariff cuts
articles.summary: India's exports are poised for a record $1,000 billion in 2026-27. New trade agreements with the US and EU are expected to boost orders. Reduced US tariffs on Indian goods offer a competitive edge. Exporters anticipate significant growth in sectors like chemicals, footwear, and marine products. This development signals a promising future for India's international trade.

articles.title: UP's economy more than doubles in 8 years to Rs 30.25 lakh crore: Eco Survey
articles.summary: Uttar Pradesh's economy has more than doubled in eight years, surpassing Rs 30.25 lakh crore. Per capita income has also doubled. The state's contribution to the national economy has grown. This marks the first presentation of an Economic Survey in the Assembly. The report highlights agricultural, industrial, and service sector growth, alongside welfare schemes and infrastructure development.

articles.title: Foreign company registrations in India hit 5-yr high in 2025, service sector account for 87%
articles.summary: Foreign companies registered a five-year high in India in 2025, with 92 new entrants, primarily from the services sector. This surge reflects growing global confidence in the Indian market, supported by government initiatives promoting a business-friendly environment and ease of doing business. Maharashtra, Karnataka, Delhi, and Gujarat attracted the majority of these new ventures.

articles.title: India will stop importing fruits, vegetables, flowers: Union Minister Chouhan
articles.summary: India is set to achieve self-reliance in fruits, vegetables, and flowers. Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that imports in these sectors will cease. The focus is on profitable domestic production for farmers. India is already producing crops like avocado, previously imported. Efforts will now extend to dragon fruits and other high-demand produce. Research will prioritize farmer-friendly, profitable varieties.

articles.title: "Quota" to US on apples less than current imports: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: "We are not surplus in apples. The demand for apples is more than 25-26 lakh tons. We produce about 20-21 lakh tons. As we speak, we import 5.5 lakh tons of apples every year. And a large quantity of that comes from the United States of America. We have not opened up apples. We have given them a quota on apples, which we will procure from there. That is less than the Current imports of apples from the USA," Goyal said in an interview with ANI.

articles.title: Aye Finance IPO Day 2: Check GMP, subscription data and broker view
articles.summary: Aye Finance's initial public offering is experiencing a subdued response. The Rs 1,010 crore issue opened to muted investor interest, with low subscription rates on its first day. Grey market premiums are flat, indicating limited expectations for immediate listing gains. Retail investors show some interest, but institutional buyers remain hesitant. The IPO closes on February 11.

articles.title: Crompton Greaves shares in focus as Q3 net profit slips 10% YoY; margins decline
articles.summary: Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals reported a Q3 FY26 net profit of Rs 101 crore, a 10% dip year-on-year, despite a 7.3% revenue rise to Rs 1,898 crore. The company is expanding into residential wires to become a comprehensive home solutions provider. Growth was seen in lighting and ECD segments, with Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances also showing strong performance.

articles.title: MFs up startup ante; Rupeek's new raise
articles.summary: Happy Tuesday! Exposure of domestic mutual funds to new-age stocks significantly increased in 2025. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Petcare startup Supertails raises $30 million led by Venturi Partners
articles.summary: Petcare startup Supertails has raised $30 million in a round led by Singapore-based investment firm Venturi Partners with participation from Nippon India Alternative Investments, Titan Capital, and existing investors Fireside Ventures, RPSG Capital Ventures, Sauce VC, and Saama Capital.

articles.title: Databricks valued at $134 billion in latest fundraise: Report
articles.summary: Databricks said on Monday it has raised about $5 billion in funding at a $134 billion valuation, as the data analytics software startup bolsters its balance sheet ‌while keeping options open ‌for a US stock market debut later this year.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: School assembly news headlines Feb 4: Top national, international, sports, business update and thought of the day
articles.summary: India and the US finalized a significant trade deal, boosting the rupee and leading to discussions on oil procurement and tariff adjustments. Meanwhile, national headlines include political developments, a tragic incident involving a Bengaluru CEO, and aviation safety concerns. Internationally, Russia's assault on Ukraine continues, and Pakistan faces challenges with defense deals and internal security.

articles.title: India bonds jump on US deal boost; profit-taking caps rise before RBI meet
articles.summary: Indian government bonds rallied early Tuesday following a U.S.-India trade deal, sparking hopes of increased foreign inflows due to a stronger rupee. However, profit-taking limited major moves as investors await the central bank's monetary policy decision. The benchmark 10-year bond yield eased after being pressured by high borrowing projections.

articles.title: HP India's Bhawana Agarwal on what the country needs next to unlock AI
articles.summary: AI operating closer to citizens can enable faster responses at hospitals, transport hubs and service points. Built on platforms such as Aadhaar, UPI and DigiLocker, deeper AI integration can strengthen verification, improve fraud detection and reduce delays across government programmes, writes HPE India Managing Director Bhawana Agarwal.

articles.title: Amber Enterprises shares jump 3% as Q3 revenue, EBITDA beat estimates; PAT turns loss
articles.summary: Amber Enterprises India Limited Q3FY26 revenue jumped 38% to ₹2,943 crore, led by electronics growth. Despite strong margins, exceptional charges caused a ₹9.33 crore net loss.

articles.title: Gold, silver slip after two straight sessions of gains
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices dropped as the US dollar rose; India’s gold ETF inflows hit a record amid changing investment trends and geopolitical risks.

articles.title: India will grow the fastest among G-20 economies in FY27: Moody's
articles.summary: The global ratings agency cites the recent tax cuts and a stable monetary policy among reasons for India's growth momentum.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to revitalise exports; marks an end to 'coldness': Carnelian Asset's Khemani
articles.summary: Vikas Khemani says the India-US interim trade framework ends a period of coldness, boosts pharma, and could open new sectors to the US market, reviving momentum in bilateral relations.

articles.title: Icra sees 10-12% copper demand growth in India over next 2 years
articles.summary: Copper usage in India is surging, driven by rapid urbanisation, infrastructure development, and the green energy transition.

articles.title: Global uncertainty drives market volatility; India relatively stable: Emmer Capital CEO
articles.summary: Manishi Raychaudhuri, Chief Executive Officer, Emmer Capital Partners said India has remained relatively stable compared with other Asian markets. He sees opportunities in financials, materials, industrials, and selective consumer stocks, while remaining cautious on IT services due to AI disruption risks.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: Delhi Metro posts ₹412.8 crore operating surplus in FY25 as revenues hit ₹4,600 crore
articles.summary: Delhi Metro’s improving balance sheet reflects a steady post-pandemic rebound, with higher ridership, tighter cost controls and growing non-fare income streams helping the urban transporter strengthen its operating performance in FY25.

articles.title: India-US trade deal gives textiles, seafood a boost, sparks rally in export stocks
articles.summary: After months of falling orders and tariff pressure, India’s textile and seafood exporters are seeing fresh momentum as the interim India-US trade deal restores price competitiveness, sparks a rally in textile stocks, and revives export enquiries from key overseas markets.

articles.title: Material Depot raises $10 million to tech-up, expand experience centres, and simplify home interiors shopping across India
articles.summary: Backed by Accel and Stellaris, Material Depot is betting on data, design curation and a capital-efficient offline rollout to organise India’s fragmented home interiors materials market and bring global styles to Indian homeowners faster.

articles.title: India's housing mkt strong, steady after crazy growth post COVID: Pirojsha Godrej
articles.summary: Pirojsha Godrej confirms strong housing demand; Godrej Properties targets ₹32,500 crore sales, exceeds land goals, and reports record profits.

articles.title: Why the ’90s ads stuck — and why today’s AI-era ads don’t
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence accelerates ad creation and shortens campaign cycles, India’s top creative leaders say something critical is being lost—time, shared viewing and emotional stickiness. From Vicco Turmeric to Kelvinator, they explain why advertising’s golden era still lives in public memory while today’s AI-era campaigns fade fast.

articles.title: Zero Russian oil unlikely despite India-US trade deal, indicates former HPCL chief
articles.summary: India and the US announced an interim trade agreement lowering tariffs on Indian exports to 18 percent, while India faces pressure to reduce Russian oil imports amid complex refinery dependencies.

articles.title: Gulf Oil sees profit dip while sales climb and EV chargers drive growth
articles.summary: Gulf Oil’s Q3 profit fell 22% to ₹77 crore even as sales and volumes rose. EV chargers and dividends show the business is moving forward steadily.

articles.title: BJP emerges as largest party in urban, semi-urban and rural areas: Fadnavis on outcome of Zilla Parishad polls
articles.summary: He said the BJP has broken its 2017 record by securing 236 seats so far in 12 districts and winning 410 seats in 125 Panchayat Samitis.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Minister says North Indians 'clean tables,' sell 'pani puri'; BJP calls it 'reckless and dangerous'
articles.summary: Speaking at an event in Chengalpattu, Panneerselvam talked about people from North India working in low-paying jobs.

articles.title: Heated exchange between Rahul and MoS Ravneet — From 'my traitor friend' to 'Desh ke dushman'
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi called Ravneet Singh Bittu a traitor at Parliament during Congress protests over MM Naravane's memoir; eight MPs were suspended.

articles.title: Foreign tourist arrivals in India dip in 2025 despite cheaper rupee
articles.summary: While a depreciation of the Indian rupee can make travel more economical for visitors, the ministry stressed that it is only one of many factors influencing foreign tourist numbers.

articles.title: Decide in 3 months Kuldeep Sengar's plea in case of death of rape survivor's father: SC to Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Supreme Court urged Delhi High Court to expedite Kuldeep Singh Sengar's plea on the Unnao rape survivor's father's custodial death, with a decision expected within three months.

articles.title: Fire on 13th floor of Vile Parle building in Mumbai leaves one dead, one injured
articles.summary: A Level-1 fire broke out on the 13th floor of Suvidha Pearl Building in Vile Parle East, Mumbai, on February 9. One woman died, another was injured, and multiple emergency teams responded.

articles.title: Govt signals preference for Indian CEOs to lead Indian airlines
articles.summary: The government believes Indian CEOs may be more capable of connecting with domestic passengers, regulators, employees and investors, particularly as aviation becomes a key pillar of India’s economic and infrastructure growth story.

articles.title: ‘Gunda raj’ not acceptable, says CJI Kant on lawyer's physical assault inside Tis Hazari court
articles.summary: CJI Surya Kant condemned a lawyer's alleged assault at Tis Hazari court. He directed the lawyer to file a complaint to Delhi High Court Chief Justice stating that such "gunda raj" is not acceptable.

articles.title: Delhi schools receive bomb threats, police search underway
articles.summary: As a safety measure, school authorities evacuated campuses while bomb detection and disposal squads, supported by sniffer dog units, began systematic searches of the premises.

articles.title: Private training aircraft crashes in Karnataka’s Vijayapura; pilot, trainee safe after ejecting
articles.summary: The aircraft belonged to Redbird Aviation in Kalaburagi. It went down at Mangaluru village in Babaleshwar Taluk. According to sources, the aircraft broke into three pieces after the crash.

articles.title: Thales scales India engineering teams as part of 9,000-plus global hiring plan
articles.summary: The India hiring will focus on specialists in hardware, software and systems at its Engineering Competence Centres in Bengaluru and Noida.

articles.title: YouTube Music locks full lyrics behind a premium subscription
articles.summary: YouTube Music now limits free users to five song lyrics, requiring a Premium subscription for full access after a global rollout.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw unveils Qualcomm's 2-nm chip, sets roadmap for Semicon 2.0
articles.summary: According to Ashwini Vaishnaw, India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 will prioritise indigenous chip design and attract ecosystem partners.

articles.title: Anthropic buys Super Bowl ads to slap OpenAI for selling ads in ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman was not amused, calling the Anthropic ad "deceptive" in a post on Wednesday on the social media platform X.

articles.title: India revises recognition criteria for startups to promote AI, deep-tech innovation
articles.summary: India has notified revised startup recognition norms, confirming CNBC-TV18’s January 28 newsbreak, raising turnover limits, introducing a deep-tech category and expanding eligibility to cooperatives to boost innovation-led growth.

articles.title: No country is AI-ready: Pearson CEO flags skill gaps in India, warns of vocational shortage
articles.summary: India and other major economies face deep-rooted workforce challenges as artificial intelligence accelerates, with Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh warning that shortages in vocational skills and educator preparedness could slow inclusive AI adoption.

articles.title: AI is making skills go obsolete faster, so learning how to learn is the real job now: Pearson CEO
articles.summary: As AI tools rapidly take over routine professional tasks, Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh says continuous learning—not static qualifications—will determine who stays relevant in the workforce, as companies and employees confront a multi-year disruption driven by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Apple begins hiring for retail roles in Hyderabad
articles.summary: Apple has issued a job notification seeking outlet managers and retail managers, among other roles, to be based here, sparking speculation that the iPhone maker may open a retail store in the city.

articles.title: Explained — Why Nvidia, Broadcom shares rose after Alphabet's capex announcement
articles.summary: Unlike many peers that rely heavily on industry-standard Nvidia processors, much of Google’s AI software runs on its in-house TPUs. The company’s latest flagship model, Gemini 3, was trained using these proprietary chips. Broadcom works with Google on the design and manufacturing of its TPUs.

articles.title: AI is the new oil: Nations, not companies, are racing for global dominance
articles.summary: Hemant Mohapatra of Lightspeed Venture Partners says the global AI race is increasingly being shaped by national control over chips, data, and foundation models. As countries build their own AI ecosystems, India’s push for sovereignty through local data, domestic model-building, and semiconductor manufacturing could determine its place in the future AI order.

articles.title: Exclusive | AI is a once-in-a-century opportunity for India: Mukesh Ambani
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani and Larry Fink believe India is uniquely positioned to lead the global AI revolution, with Reliance placing a major bet on the technology as the country’s next growth engine. From transforming education and healthcare to boosting productivity, AI could redefine India’s economic standing over the next two decades.

articles.title: Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radar
articles.summary: Nitish Mittersain, Joint MD and CEO of Nazara Technologies said that the company saw about 10% organic revenue growth and more than 25% profitability growth, excluding acquisitions and deconsolidation. The company invested about ₹500 crore in acquisitions last year and has about ₹700 crore in net cash. The company may raise capital if required, but no decision has been finalised.

Advanced Air Mobility, using electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft, aims to ease congestion by utilizing low-altitude airspace. Many fear reporting issues due to potential expulsion and visa complications.

articles.title: PSLV-C62 Mishap: Failure analysis committee to be formed soon
articles.summary: ISRO is forming a Failure Analysis Committee to probe the PSLV-C62 mishap. An internal data analysis committee is meticulously reviewing flight data, telemetry, and logs to pinpoint the cause. This investigation follows a previous PSLV failure, prompting a comprehensive review of the 33-year-old rocket. Future PSLV and SSLV launches are on hold pending these findings.

Starbucks is also providing zero-sugar options. This trend targets health-aware consumers who value their lifestyle.
